#labels Phase-Reference

This is the reference for the GEarthExtensions.util Namespace.

This class/namespace hybrid contains miscellaneous utility functions and shortcuts for the Earth API.



<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />









----
=Static Methods=

==clearAllJsData(feature)==

Clears all JS-side data for the given KmlFeature.


===Parameters:===

  * *feature* _{{{KmlFeature}}}_  The feature to clear data on.

----

==clearJsDataValue(feature, key)==

Clears the JS-side data for the given KmlFeature associated with the given key.


===Parameters:===

  * *feature* _{{{KmlFeature}}}_  The feature to clear data on.
  * *key* _{{{string}}}_  The data key whose value should be cleared.

----

==getCamera(altitudeMode)==

Gets the current view as a KmlCamera.


===Parameters:===

  * *altitudeMode* _{{{number}}}_ (Optional, Default: ALTITUDE_ABSOLUTE) The altitude mode that the resulting camera should be in.

===Returns:===
KmlCamera


Returns the current view as a KmlCamera.



----

==getJsDataValue(feature, key)==

Gets the JS-side data for the given KmlFeature associated with the given key. WARNING: This method currently stores custom data in the feature's &lt;snippet&gt;. Data must be cleared out with clearJsData before manipulating the snippet or using getKml.


===Parameters:===

  * *feature* _{{{KmlFeature}}}_  The feature to get data for.
  * *key*   

----

==getLookAt(altitudeMode)==

Gets the current view as a KmlLookAt.


===Parameters:===

  * *altitudeMode* _{{{number}}}_ (Optional, Default: ALTITUDE_ABSOLUTE) The altitude mode that the resulting LookAt should be in.

===Returns:===
KmlLookAt


Returns the current view as a KmlLookAt.



----

==hasJsData(feature)==

Returns whether or not the KmlFeature has any JS-side data.


===Parameters:===

  * *feature* _{{{KmlFeature}}}_  The feature to inquire about.

----

==lookAt()==

Creates a KmlLookAt and sets it as the Earth plugin's view. This function takes the same parameters as GEarthExtensions#dom.LookAt.


----

==serializeView()==




----

==setJsDataValue(feature, key, value)==

Sets the JS-side data for the given KmlFeature associated with the given key to the passed in value. WARNING: This method currently stores custom data in the feature's &lt;snippet&gt;. Data must be cleared out with clearJsData before manipulating the snippet or using getKml.


===Parameters:===

  * *feature* _{{{KmlFeature}}}_  The feature to get data for.
  * *key*   
  * *value*
